channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Variational Framework for Improving Naturalness in Generative Spoken Language Models
item.description: The success of large language models in text processing has inspired their adaptation to speech modeling.

item.title: Expressive Score-Based Priors for Distribution Matching with Geometry-Preserving Regularization
item.description: This approach eliminates biases from fixed priors (e. g., in VAEs), enabling more effective use of geometry-preserving regularization, while avoiding the challenge of learning an explicit prior density model (e. g., a flow-based prior).

item.title: RMIT-ADM+S at the SIGIR 2025 LiveRAG Challenge
item.description: This paper presents the RMIT--ADM+S participation in the SIGIR 2025 LiveRAG Challenge.

item.title: Refining music sample identification with a self-supervised graph neural network
item.description: Automatic sample identification (ASID), the detection and identification of portions of audio recordings that have been reused in new musical works, is an essential but challenging task in the field of audio query-based retrieval.

item.title: Towards Robust Learning to Optimize with Theoretical Guarantees
item.description: Based on our proposed methodology of aligning OOD problems to InD problems, we also demonstrate that the L2O model's convergence rate in OOD scenarios will deteriorate by an equation of the L2O model's input features.

item.title: TriGuard: Testing Model Safety with Attribution Entropy, Verification, and Drift
item.description: Deep neural networks often achieve high accuracy, but ensuring their reliability under adversarial and distributional shifts remains a pressing challenge.

item.title: KDMOS:Knowledge Distillation for Motion Segmentation
item.description: To handle the severe imbalance between moving and non-moving classes, we decouple them and apply tailored distillation strategies, allowing the teacher model to better learn key motion-related features.

item.title: Leveraging Predictive Equivalence in Decision Trees
item.description: We present a boolean logical representation of decision trees that does not exhibit predictive equivalence and is faithful to the underlying decision boundary.

item.title: Common Benchmarks Undervalue the Generalization Power of Programmatic Policies
item.description: Algorithms for learning programmatic representations for sequential decision-making problems are often evaluated on out-of-distribution (OOD) problems, with the common conclusion that programmatic policies generalize better than neural policies on OOD problems.

item.title: Navigating the growing field of research on AI for software testing -- the taxonomy for AI-augmented software testing and an ontology-driven literature survey
item.description: This paper reviews recent research on AI augmentation in software test automation, from no automation to full automation.

item.title: Busting the Paper Ballot: Voting Meets Adversarial Machine Learning
item.description: We show the security risk associated with using machine learning classifiers in United States election tabulators.

item.title: Déjà Vu: Efficient Video-Language Query Engine with Learning-based Inter-Frame Computation Reuse
item.description: This paper introduces D\'ej\`a Vu, a video-language query engine that accelerates ViT-based VideoLMs by reusing computations across consecutive frames.

item.title: RL-Obfuscation: Can Language Models Learn to Evade Latent-Space Monitors?
item.description: Latent-space monitors aim to detect undesirable behaviours in large language models by leveraging internal model representations rather than relying solely on black-box outputs.

item.title: Comprehensive Verilog Design Problems: A Next-Generation Benchmark Dataset for Evaluating Large Language Models and Agents on RTL Design and Verification
item.description: We present the Comprehensive Verilog Design Problems (CVDP) benchmark, a new dataset and infrastructure to advance LLM and agent research in hardware design and verification.

item.title: Probabilistic Aggregation and Targeted Embedding Optimization for Collective Moral Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown impressive moral reasoning abilities.

item.title: Dataset distillation for memorized data: Soft labels can leak held-out teacher knowledge
item.description: In this work, we show that students trained on soft labels from teachers can achieve non-trivial accuracy on held-out memorized data they never directly observed.

item.title: SCISSOR: Mitigating Semantic Bias through Cluster-Aware Siamese Networks for Robust Classification
item.description: Our study redefines the landscape of model generalization by addressing overlooked semantic biases, establishing SCISSOR as a foundational framework for mitigating shortcut learning and fostering more robust, bias-resistant AI systems.

item.title: Overcoming Overfitting in Reinforcement Learning via Gaussian Process Diffusion Policy
item.description: One of the key challenges that Reinforcement Learning (RL) faces is its limited capability to adapt to a change of data distribution caused by uncertainties.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks as Privacy Tools: Reliability, Disparity and Ensemble
item.description: Membership inference attacks (MIAs) pose a significant threat to the privacy of machine learning models and are widely used as tools for privacy assessment, auditing, and machine unlearning.

item.title: PeakWeather: MeteoSwiss Weather Station Measurements for Spatiotemporal Deep Learning
item.description: Accurate weather forecasts are essential for supporting a wide range of activities and decision-making processes, as well as mitigating the impacts of adverse weather events.

item.title: Vector Ontologies as an LLM world view extraction method
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) possess intricate internal representations of the world, yet these latent structures are notoriously difficult to interpret or repurpose beyond the original prediction task.

item.title: EAQuant: Enhancing Post-Training Quantization for MoE Models via Expert-Aware Optimization
item.description: Existing post-training quantization (PTQ) methods struggle to address activation outliers, router consistency and sparse expert calibration, leading to significant performance degradation.

item.title: Vine Copulas as Differentiable Computational Graphs
item.description: Vine copulas are sophisticated models for multivariate distributions and are increasingly used in machine learning.

item.title: Global Convergence of Adjoint-Optimized Neural PDEs
item.description: The resulting neural-network PDE model, being a function of the neural network parameters, can be calibrated to available data by optimizing over the PDE using gradient descent, where the gradient is evaluated in a computationally efficient manner by solving an adjoint PDE.

item.title: HELENA: High-Efficiency Learning-based channel Estimation using dual Neural Attention
item.description: Accurate channel estimation is critical for high-performance Orthogonal Frequency-Division Multiplexing systems such as 5G New Radio, particularly under low signal-to-noise ratio and stringent latency constraints.

item.title: Efficient Approximate Temporal Triangle Counting in Streaming with Predictions
item.description: Streaming processing and resource efficiency are crucial requirements for counting triangles in modern massive temporal graphs, with millions of nodes and up to billions of temporal edges.

item.title: Unlearning Isn't Invisible: Detecting Unlearning Traces in LLMs from Model Outputs
item.description: These traces can be identified from output responses, even when prompted with forget-irrelevant inputs.

item.title: Sketched Sum-Product Networks for Joins
item.description: By representing these univariate distributions as sketches, Sum-Product Networks can combine them element-wise to efficiently approximate the sketch of any query selection.

item.title: Density-aware Walks for Coordinated Campaign Detection
item.description: Our findings demonstrate that incorporating density-aware structural encoding with MPNNs provides a robust framework for identifying coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media networks such as Twitter.

item.title: Rectifying Privacy and Efficacy Measurements in Machine Unlearning: A New Inference Attack Perspective
item.description: In this work, we first identify several key pitfalls of the existing unlearning evaluation frameworks, e. g., focusing on average-case evaluation or targeting random samples for evaluation, incomplete comparisons with the retraining baseline.

item.title: SuperPoint-SLAM3: Augmenting ORB-SLAM3 with Deep Features, Adaptive NMS, and Learning-Based Loop Closure
item.description: Visual simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) must remain accurate under extreme viewpoint, scale and illumination variations.

item.title: Lecture Video Visual Objects (LVVO) Dataset: A Benchmark for Visual Object Detection in Educational Videos
item.description: We introduce the Lecture Video Visual Objects (LVVO) dataset, a new benchmark for visual object detection in educational video content.

item.title: Stream-Omni: Simultaneous Multimodal Interactions with Large Language-Vision-Speech Model
item.description: The emergence of GPT-4o-like large multimodal models (LMMs) has raised the exploration of integrating text, vision, and speech modalities to support more flexible multimodal interaction.

item.title: AutoVLA: A Vision-Language-Action Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving with Adaptive Reasoning and Reinforcement Fine-Tuning
item.description: Recent advancements in Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models have shown promise for end-to-end autonomous driving by leveraging world knowledge and reasoning capabilities.

item.title: A Survey on World Models Grounded in Acoustic Physical Information
item.description: This survey provides a comprehensive overview of the emerging field of world models grounded in the foundation of acoustic physical information.

item.title: DETRPose: Real-time end-to-end transformer model for multi-person pose estimation
item.description: The paper presents a family of transformer-based models capable of performing multi-person 2D pose estimation in real-time.

item.title: SatHealth: A Multimodal Public Health Dataset with Satellite-based Environmental Factors
item.description: Living environments play a vital role in the prevalence and progression of diseases, and understanding their impact on patient's health status becomes increasingly crucial for developing AI models.

item.title: Arctic Long Sequence Training: Scalable And Efficient Training For Multi-Million Token Sequences
item.description: ALST supports training Meta's Llama 8B model with 500K sequence length on a single H100 GPU, 3. 7M on a single 8xH100 GPU node, and over 15M on a 4 node cluster, an increase of over 400x compared to the 32K baseline for the latter.

item.title: SAGDA: Open-Source Synthetic Agriculture Data for Africa
item.description: Data scarcity in African agriculture hampers machine learning (ML) model performance, limiting innovations in precision agriculture.

item.title: Personalizable Long-Context Symbolic Music Infilling with MIDI-RWKV
item.description: Existing work in automatic music generation has primarily focused on end-to-end systems that produce complete compositions or continuations.

item.title: VIS-Shepherd: Constructing Critic for LLM-based Data Visualization Generation
item.description: Data visualization generation using Large Language Models (LLMs) has shown promising results but often produces suboptimal visualizations that require human intervention for improvement.

item.title: Verifying the Verifiers: Unveiling Pitfalls and Potentials in Fact Verifiers
item.description: In this study, we evaluate 12 pre-trained LLMs and one specialized fact-verifier, including frontier LLMs and open-weight reasoning LLMs, using a collection of examples from 14 fact-checking benchmarks.

item.title: TextureSplat: Per-Primitive Texture Mapping for Reflective Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Gaussian Splatting have demonstrated remarkable novel view synthesis performance at high rendering frame rates.

item.title: Tady: A Neural Disassembler without Structural Constraint Violations
item.description: Disassembly is a crucial yet challenging step in binary analysis.

item.title: CertDW: Towards Certified Dataset Ownership Verification via Conformal Prediction
item.description: If the number of PP values smaller than WR exceeds a threshold, the suspicious model is regarded as having been trained on the protected dataset.

item.title: Agent Capability Negotiation and Binding Protocol (ACNBP)
item.description: As multi-agent systems evolve to encompass increasingly diverse and specialized agents, the challenge of enabling effective collaboration between heterogeneous agents has become paramount, with traditional agent communication protocols often assuming homogeneous environments or predefined interaction patterns that limit their applicability in dynamic, open-world scenarios.

item.title: CoIFNet: A Unified Framework for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting with Missing Values
item.description: Multivariate time series forecasting (MTSF) is a critical task with broad applications in domains such as meteorology, transportation, and economics.

item.title: BeyondRPC: A Contrastive and Augmentation-Driven Framework for Robust Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: Robust perception of 3D point clouds remains a significant challenge in real-world environments where sensor data is often corrupted.

item.title: SoundMind: RL-Incentivized Logic Reasoning for Audio-Language Models
item.description: While large language models have shown reasoning capabilities, their application to the audio modality, particularly in large audio-language models (ALMs), remains significantly underdeveloped.

item.title: A Review of the Long Horizon Forecasting Problem in Time Series Analysis
item.description: The long horizon forecasting (LHF) problem has come up in the time series literature for over the last 35 years or so.
